model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.util.Observable
    Class for maintaing the state of the Board.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dré van Oorschot, Andrei Raureanu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Creates a board object.

      Checks whether the given mark meets the win condition of having an entire column of marks.

      Checks whether the given mark meets the win condition of having a diagonal in the plains of columns and height.

      Checks whether the given mark meets the win condition of having a stack of marks matching the height of the board.

      Checks whether the given mark meets the win condition of having an entire row of marks.

      Checks whether the given mark meets the win condition of having a diagonal in the plains of rows and columns.

      Checks whether the given mark meets the win condition of having a 3 dimensional diagonal of equal length of the boards dimensions.

      Checks whether the given mark meets the win condition of having a diagonal in the plains of rows and height.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Creates a board object.

    • Method Detail

      • getDIM

        public int getDIM()
        Returns the dimensions of all boards.
        Returns:
        the dimensions of the boards.

      • setDIM

        public static void setDIM(int dimension)
        Sets the Dimensions of all boards instances.
        Parameters:
        dimension - the supposed new dimension of the boards.

      • deepCopy

        public Board deepCopy()
        Returns a deepCopy() of the current board state.
        Returns:
        copy of the current board state.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the board by setting all fields to an empty mark.

      • setField

        public void setField(int col,
                     int row,
                     model.Mark m)
        Sets a mark on the board by giving a column and a row as a parameter. A gravity algorithm takes care of the height of the mark.
        Parameters:
        col - column in which the mark is supposed to be put.
        row - row in which the mark is supposed to be put.
        m - mark that has to be set for the specified field.

      • getField

        public model.Mark getField(int col,
                           int row,
                           int height)
        Returns the mark of a specified field.
        Parameters:
        col - column in which the required field occurs.
        row - row in which the required field occurs.
        height - height on which the required field occurs.
        Returns:
        mark of the specified field.

      • hasRow

        public boolean hasRow(model.Mark m)
        Checks whether the given mark meets the win condition of having an entire row of marks.
        Parameters:
        m - the mark for which the win condition should be checked
        Returns:
        true if win condition is met, false if win condition is not met.

      • hasColumn

        public boolean hasColumn(model.Mark m)
        Checks whether the given mark meets the win condition of having an entire column of marks.
        Parameters:
        m - the mark for which the win condition should be checked
        Returns:
        true if win condition is met, false if win condition is not met.

      • hasHeight

        public boolean hasHeight(model.Mark m)
        Checks whether the given mark meets the win condition of having a stack of marks matching the height of the board.
        Parameters:
        m - the mark for which the win condition should be checked
        Returns:
        true if win condition is met, false if win condition is not met.

      • hasRowColumn

        public boolean hasRowColumn(model.Mark m)
        Checks whether the given mark meets the win condition of having a diagonal in the plains of rows and columns.
        Parameters:
        m - the mark for which the win condition should be checked
        Returns:
        true if win condition is met, false if win condition is not met.

      • hasRowHeight

        public boolean hasRowHeight(model.Mark m)
        Checks whether the given mark meets the win condition of having a diagonal in the plains of rows and height.
        Parameters:
        m - the mark for which the win condition should be checked
        Returns:
        true if win condition is met, false if win condition is not met.

      • hasColumnHeight

        public boolean hasColumnHeight(model.Mark m)
        Checks whether the given mark meets the win condition of having a diagonal in the plains of columns and height.
        Parameters:
        m - the mark for which the win condition should be checked
        Returns:
        true if win condition is met, false if win condition is not met.

      • hasRowColumnHeight

        public boolean hasRowColumnHeight(model.Mark m)
        Checks whether the given mark meets the win condition of having a 3 dimensional diagonal of equal length of the boards dimensions.
        Parameters:
        m - the mark for which the win condition should be checked
        Returns:
        true if win condition is met, false if win condition is not met.

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Checks whether the board is full. In other words if there are still empty marks in the board.
        Returns:
        true if board is full, false if there are still empty marks left.

      • isWinner

        public boolean isWinner(model.Mark m)
        Checks whether the given mark meets any of the win conditions.
        Parameters:
        m - mark for which needs to be checked whether one of the win conditions has been met.
        Returns:
        true if mark meets a win condition, false if mark doesn't meet any win condition.

      • hasWinner

        public boolean hasWinner()
        Indicates if one of the marks (not the empty mark) meets a win condition.
        Returns:
        true if one of the marks meets a win condition, false if none of the marks meets a win condition.

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver()
        Checks whether the game is over. The game is over when board is either full, or there one of the marks meets a win condition.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over, false is the game is not yet over.
